channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: As funding falters, young brain scientists rethink careers in research
item.description: Research on brain disorders may slow as young neuroscientists struggle to find jobs and research grants.
item.content:encoded:
Research on brain disorders may slow as young neuroscientists struggle to find jobs and research grants.

(Image credit: Cemile Bingol/Digital Vision Vectors)
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: More liberals, people of color and LGBTQ Americans say they're buying guns out of fear
item.description: The image of gun ownership in America has been white, rural and Republican, but that's been changing as more liberals and minorities have been buying guns, especially after the 2024 election.
item.content:encoded:
The image of gun ownership in America has been white, rural and Republican, but that's been changing as more liberals and minorities have been buying guns, especially after the 2024 election.

(Image credit: Hadassah Grout Photography)
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: Right-wing media shrugs off latest Epstein document release
item.description: "To me, these are nothingburgers. If they're even real," said one pro-Trump podcaster, of the thousands of documents that were released this week, including several that named the president.
item.content:encoded:
"To me, these are nothingburgers. If they're even real," said one pro-Trump podcaster, of the thousands of documents that were released this week, including several that named the president.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: The longest government shutdown in U.S. history is over. Here's what you need to know
item.description: The government is back open. There are lots of questions about what this means, how we got here and where we go from here. Let's dig in.
item.content:encoded:
The government is back open. There are lots of questions about what this means, how we got here and where we go from here. Let's dig in.

(Image credit: Hu Yousong)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: The deal to end the shutdown exposed rifts among Democrats. Just ask Maine
item.description: Maine's four-person Congressional delegation is one of the smallest in the country. Yet their mixed votes on the bill to reopen the government reflect the national divide over the fraught issue.
item.content:encoded:
Maine's four-person Congressional delegation is one of the smallest in the country. Yet their mixed votes on the bill to reopen the government reflect the national divide over the fraught issue.

(Image credit: Al Drago/Bloomberg via Getty Images, Nathan Posner/Anadolu via Getty Images, J. Scott Applewhite/AP, Gregory Rec/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Kevin Miller

item.title: At Trump's urging, Bondi says U.S. will investigate Epstein's ties to political foes
item.description: Acceding to President Donald Trump's demands, U.S. Attorney General Pam Bondi said Friday that she has ordered a top federal prosecutor to investigate Jeffrey Epstein's ties to Trump political foes.
item.content:encoded:
Acceding to President Donald Trump's demands, U.S. Attorney General Pam Bondi said Friday that she has ordered a top federal prosecutor to investigate Jeffrey Epstein's ties to Trump political foes.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump cuts ties with Marjorie Taylor Greene, once among his top MAGA-world defenders
item.description: The dismissal of Greene — once the epitome of "Make America Great Again" — appeared to be the final break in a dispute simmering for months.
item.content:encoded:
The dismissal of Greene — once the epitome of "Make America Great Again" — appeared to be the final break in a dispute simmering for months.

(Image credit: Rod Lamkey)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump scraps tariffs on beef, coffee, tropical fruit in a push to lower prices
item.description: President Trump announced the removal of U.S. tariffs on beef, coffee, tropical fruits and other commodities amid pressure to address high consumer prices.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump announced the removal of U.S. tariffs on beef, coffee, tropical fruits and other commodities amid pressure to address high consumer prices.

(Image credit: Manuel Balce Ceneta)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Better late than never: The delayed September jobs report will be out next week
item.description: The Bureau of Labor Statistics says it will report on September's job gains and unemployment rate next week. That's the first of many overdue economic reports held up by the government shutdown.
item.content:encoded:
The Bureau of Labor Statistics says it will report on September's job gains and unemployment rate next week. That's the first of many overdue economic reports held up by the government shutdown.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Alaska station that covered devastating storm cuts jobs
item.description: A public TV and radio station in Western Alaska serves dozens of villages damaged by Typhoon Halong. But with federal funding eliminated, KYUK makes severe cuts to its staff and news department.
item.content:encoded:
A public TV and radio station in Western Alaska serves dozens of villages damaged by Typhoon Halong. But with federal funding eliminated, KYUK makes severe cuts to its staff and news department.

(Image credit: Claire Harbage)
item.dc:creator: Jeff Brady
